references.paper_title: Universal Sequential Coding of Single Messages
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of the Shtarkov sum, which is central to the characterization of minimax regret in sequential probability assignment.

references.paper_title: Online learning: Random averages, combinatorial parameters, and learnability
references.reason: This paper formalizes the online supervised learning framework used in the analysis of sequential probability assignment with contexts, laying the foundation for many subsequent works in this area.

references.paper_title: Sequential complexities and uniform martingale laws of large numbers
references.reason: This paper introduces important tools like sequential complexities which provides a better understanding of minimax regret for sequential probability assignment.

references.paper_title: Tight bounds on minimax regret under logarithmic loss via self-concordance
references.reason: This paper establishes tight bounds on minimax regret and improves the understanding of the role of sequential entropy.

references.paper_title: Regret Bounds for Log-loss via Bayesian Algorithms
references.reason: This paper proposes a Bayesian algorithmic approach to upper bound the regret and provides a new perspective on the problem.
